fact_list.fact_text: Motorists are encouraged to tune into an FM radio channel before entering the tunnel.
Portable fire extinguishers are provided in emergency cabinets available at 50m intervals along the tunnel.
Motorists can use fire extinguishers to put out small scale fires in their vehicles.
MCE and Woodsville tunnels are equipped with a water-based firefighting system.
The overhead water sprinkler system suppresses fire growth rates to protect major structural elements of the tunnel and minimize fire impact.
The water-based firefighting system combined with the ventilation system enhances incident management during a fire.
Motorists should switch on vehicle hazard lights if their vehicle breaks down.
Motorists should drive onto the road shoulder and stop the vehicle if possible in case of a breakdown.
Motorists can use the nearest emergency SOS phone next to the slow lane of the tunnel to contact OCC for assistance during a vehicle breakdown.
Motorists can dial 1800-CALL LTA (1800-2255582) to seek assistance for a breakdown.
LTA EMAS vehicle recovery service crew will tow a stalled vehicle to the nearest designated car park.
Motorists involved in accidents without injury or serious damage are advised to drive out of the tunnel and discuss details at a safe location, such as a public car park.
Motorists can use the nearest emergency SOS phone to contact OCC if an accident occurs in the tunnel and there is injury or an unmovable vehicle.
Motorists can dial 1800-CALL LTA (1800-2255582), 995, or 999 for assistance in the event of an accident.
LTA EMAS and SCDF/Traffic Police response teams will assist motorists at the site of an accident.
Motorists should use a manual call point to sound an alarm and wait for help if their vehicle is on fire.
Motorists can use a portable fire extinguisher from the emergency cabinet to extinguish the smoke if the fire is manageable.
Motorists can contact OCC using 1800-CALL LTA (1800-2255582) or the nearest emergency SOS phone for assistance if their vehicle is on fire.
LTA and SCDF/Traffic Police response teams will arrive at the incident site to assist a motorist whose vehicle is on fire.
Motorists in the tunnel should listen to local radio channels for LTA emergency announcements and instructions during a tunnel emergency.
Motorists should not attempt to reverse their vehicle during a tunnel emergency but turn off the engine and leave the vehicle.
Motorists should proceed to the nearest exit or escape route to leave the tunnel immediately during a tunnel emergency.
